segments.text: What were you and Richard talking about earlier ? It looked intense .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , Richard said something to me that I didn't appreciate .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , no . I know how insensitive he can be . What has he done now ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: He asked me how long it took me to learn English .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But , you were born and raised in California !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , but I get that sometimes . It doesn't matter how many generations my family has lived in the U . S . , we'll always be foreigners in their eyes .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What a racist ! How can you stand working with the guy ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You know , Richard isn't such a bad guy . He made the comment out of ignorance , not malice .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So , what did you say when he asked you how long it took you to learn English ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I told him 28 years . And , he knows I'm 28 years old since I just celebrated my birthday last week . He was puzzled for a minute , and then he got it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Are you sure he really got the message ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah , I'm pretty sure since I then asked him how long it took him to learn English .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's hilarious ! What did he say ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: He said , ' 36 years , ' and we both laughed about it . He apologized and now , it's all good .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'm glad . I bet he won't make that mistake again .
segments.speaker: S1
